intro: Cerastium beeringianum subsp. jenisejense, commonly known as the Jenisejense mouse-ear, is a low-growing perennial herb native to the Arctic and subarctic regions. It belongs to the family Caryophyllaceae and is characterized by its small, hairy leaves and clusters of white or pink flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to cold climates. It has a compact growth habit and is often found in tundra and alpine environments. Its flowers bloom in late summer, attracting various pollinators in its harsh habitat.
